title: Getting Started
description: Install & run with Docker

title: NGINX Proxy
description: This section requires NGINX.

title: NGINX Proxy with SSL
description: This section requires NGINX.

title: ShareX
description: If you're using ShareX, you can head to your user management page within Zipline.

title: Flameshot
description: This section requires Flameshot, jq, and xsel.

title: cURL
description: You can upload files using this simple shell script. You can export the $TOKEN AND $HOST in your .bashrc or .zshrc (whatever shell you use), or just replace them with their actual values within the script it self.

title: OAuth
description: Zipline now supports user registration via OAuth providers. This guide will walk you through the process of setting up OAuth for your Zipline instance.

title: Discord
description: This will walk you through the process of setting up Discord OAuth for your Zipline instance.

title: GitHub
description: This will walk you through the process of setting up GitHub OAuth for your Zipline instance.

title: Google
description: This will walk you through the process of setting up Google OAuth for your Zipline instance.

title: List Users
description: This script will list the users, with any additional properties you specify.

title: Read Config
description: This script will read the configuration file and print the values that it has parsed. This may be useful if the environment variables you specify are not being parsed correctly.

title: Set User
description: This script allows you to modify any user in the database.

title: Upload Options
description: When uploading files you have a few options to choose from in the form of headers.

title: Discord Webhooks
description: Zipline now supports notifications via Discord webhooks.

title: Releases
description: When using Docker, you have two release channels you can use.

title: External Links
description: You can now add external links in the sidebar of Zipline.

title: Human Readable Byte Sizes
description: Some config values support human readable byte sizes. For example, UPLOADERADMINLIMIT=50mb is the same as UPLOADERADMINLIMIT=52428800. The following units are supported:

title: Debugging
description: If you happen to encounter some sort of bug in Zipline, you can enable debug logs to help us figure out the problem.

title: Importing Data
description: This guide may be useful if you are migrating from another host to Zipline. this may only work if the data is in a directory. Other datasources like S3 will not work with this method.

title: Docker: Migrate from PostgreSQL 14 to 15
description: This guide describes how to migrate from PostgreSQL 14 to 15, since migrating through docker is a bit of a chore. This guide also assumes that you are using docker and the provided docker-compose file's defaults for postgres. If you don't use docker-compose figure it out yourself

title: TOTP (2FA - Authy, Google Authenticator)
description: Zipline now supports authentication methods like, Authy and Google Authenticator. This is done via TOTP (Time-based One-time Password Algorithm). This is a standard that is used by many services to provide 2FA.

title: Variables
description: Variables can be used to customize the text used in embeds and discord webhook text. Variables allow allow certain modifiers, that modify their appearance.

title: Configuration
description: You can run Zipline with only a few configuration options, while everything else has a default option.

title: Datasource
description: Zipline supports using different types of ways to store files. It defaults to saving files to the disk but Zipline now supports Amazon S3 and OpenStack Swift.

title: Local
description: Configuration for the local datasource.

title: S3
description: Configuration for the s3 datasource. In theory, when setup with the correct options, any S3 compatible storage should work with Zipline.

title: Supabase
description: Configuration for the supabase datasource. Ability to connect with Supabase's storage API.

title: Chunks
description: This page documents the file chunking configuration of Zipline. Chunking may be useful when uploading large files while using Cloudflare's Free Plan which limits the maximum upload size to 100MB.

title: Core
description: This page documents the core configuration of Zipline.

title: Discord
description: This page documents the discord webhook configuration of Zipline.

title: Exiftool Metadata
description: This page documents how Zipline should handle metadata from Exiftool.

title: Features
description: This page documents features that can be disabled or enabled in Zipline.

title: Multi-Factor Authentication
description: This page documents multi-factor authentication options, such as Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) via services like Google Authenticator and Authy.

title: OAuth
description: This page documents OAuth variables that can be set in Zipline.

title: Ratelimit
description: This page documents the ratelimit configuration of Zipline.

title: SSL
description: This page documents the SSL configuration of Zipline.

title: Uploader
description: This page documents the uploader configuration of Zipline.

title: URLs
description: This page documents the url shortener configuration of Zipline.

title: Website
description: This page documents the frontend configuration of Zipline.

title: API Reference
description: This page attempts to document the entire Zipline API, currently it is a work in progress.

title: File
description: The file model is used to represent a file in the database.

title: Invite
description: The invite model is used to represent a invite in the database.

title: User
description: The user model is used to represent a user in the database.

title: /api/auth/oauth
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/auth/oauth/[provider]
description: Whenever there are errors, the response will redirect to the /oautherror page. All responses on this page are based on if FEATURESHEADLESS was set to true, therefore all responses will be JSON.

title: /api/auth/create
description: Create a user (invite/regisration)

title: /api/auth/image
description: Get an image

title: /api/auth/invite
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/auth/login
description: Login

title: /api/auth/login
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/user
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/user/mfa/totp
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/user/[id]
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/user/check
description: Check if a user exists

title: /api/user/export
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/user/files
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/user/paged
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/user/recent
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/user/token
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/user/urls
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/exif
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/shorten
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/stats
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/upload
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/users
description: Requires authentication

title: /api/version
description: Requires authentication

title: v3.6.4
description: * COREHTTPS is now CORERETURN_HTTPS

title: v3.6.3
description: Bugfixes

title: v3.6.2
description: What's Changed

title: v3.6.1
description: What's Changed

title: v3.6.0
description: What's Changed

title: v3.5.1
description: * Discord webhook notifications (upload and shorten only at the moment)

title: v3.5.0
description: * Update to Mantine v5 (with this comes many frontend changes)

title: v3.4.8
description: * Configuration file (TOML) has been removed, in favor for environment variables. If you would still like to use a file for your configuration you may use .env.local as the file. Please use the .env.local.example file as a starting point

title: v3.4.7
description: What's Changed

title: v3.4.6
description: * Tons of refactoring to the code base: server code, ratelimits, configuration, readme

title: v3.4.5
description: What's Changed

title: v3.4.4
description: What's Changed

title: v3.4.3
description: Zipline now supports arm64 using a separate image ghcr.io/diced/zipline/arm:trunk

title: v3.4.2
description: - Domains field in user

title: v3.4.1
description: Notable changes:

title: v3.4.0
description: Notable changes:

title: v3.3.1
description: - More actions on dashboard tables

title: v3.3.0
description: - Caching of statistics for the home page, to reduce slow downs when querying servers with large amounts of files (#115)

title: v3.2.4
description: - hopefully migrations should be fixed (no longer needing to run yarn prisma migrate deploy)

title: v3.2.3
description: - configuration validation is now revamped with yup

title: v3.2.2
description: * audio and video files are now supported so you can view them on the dashboard

title: v3.2.1
description: ZWS is now implemented, feel free to use it by just adding ZWS: true to the headers.

title: v3.2.0
description: This update brings in custom themes, and curated themes (create PR's to add your own themes)

title: v3.1.0
description: Migrate from multi-db to postgresql for ease of use due to docker-compose (docker-compose up and you have a zipline instance)

title: v3.0.0
description: Total rewrite of Zipline! See how to use https://zipline.diced.me
